evidence: We explored the possibility of combining a collection obtained in a statistical , unsupervised manner , DIRT , with a hand-crafted lexical resource in order to make inference rules have a larger contribution to applications .
text: We explored the possibility of combining a collection obtained in a statistical , unsupervised manner , DIRT , with a hand-crafted lexical resource in order to make inference rules have a larger contribution to applications .

evidence: For this purpose , we start with an automatically acquired collection and we propose methods to refine it and obtain more rules using a hand-crafted lexical resource .
text: For this purpose , we start with an automatically acquired collection and we propose methods to refine it and obtain more rules using a hand-crafted lexical resource .

evidence: Furthermore , although all the inference rules we used aim at recognizing positive entailment cases , it is natural to use them for detecting negative cases of entailment as well .
text: Furthermore , although all the inference rules we used aim at recognizing positive entailment cases , it is natural to use them for detecting negative cases of entailment as well .

evidence: The evaluation of our approach on the recognizing textual entailment data shows promising results on precision and the error analysis suggests possible improvements .
text: The evaluation of our approach on the recognizing textual entailment data shows promising results on precision and the error analysis suggests possible improvements .

evidence: In this paper , we explore ways of improving an inference rule collection and its application to the task of recognizing textual entailment .
text: In this paper , we explore ways of improving an inference rule collection and its application to the task of recognizing textual entailment .
